course_title: Special Topics: Political Science: Contmp Controv in Med and Pols
class_notes:
In conjunction with the SOM


In this one-credit course, students will study the role of mass communication and social media in influencing beliefs about the effectiveness and side effects of medical treatments, the prevalence of disease, and the ethics of medical research. Students will learn how medical conspiracy theories and misinformation spread among the population and how politicians can exacerbate or undermine these dynamics.
course_description: Selected topics and problems in political science. Content will vary in successive offerings of this course. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
